caption.p: Chest CT scan from a 50-year-old male Chinese patient with a confirmed diagnosis of novel COVID-19-infected pneumonia. The patient presented with low-grade fever, cough, sneezing, fatigue, and lymphopenia. Multiple peripheral ground-glass opacities are present in both lungs (predominant on the right side), with a subpleural distribution. Imaging findings are nonspecific and might be seen with other viral pneumonias as well. Images are courtesy of Min Liu, MD, Department of Radiology, China-Japan Friendship Hospital (Beijing, China).
